com.frostphyr.avail.text

Class TextUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.frostphyr.avail.text.TextUtils

  • public class TextUtils
extends Object
    A class containing various utility methods relating to text; most notably String and CharSequence.
    Since:
    1.5

    • Method Detail

      • substring

        public static String substring(String string,
                               int beginIndex,
                               SurrogatePairPolicy policy)
        Returns a new String that is a substring of string, from beginIndex (inclusive) to the end of string.

        The difference between this method and String.substring(int) is that this method allows you to specify a SurrogatePairPolicy to determine how a surrogate pair should be handled if the pair would normally be split.

        Parameters:
        string - the String to create a substring from
        beginIndex - the beginning index (inclusive)
        policy - the SurrogatePairPolicy to use if a surrogate pair would normally be split
        Returns:
        a substring of string, beginning at beginIndex, unless changed by policy
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if string or policy is null, or beginIndex is negative or greater than the length of string

      • substring

        public static String substring(String string,
                               int beginIndex,
                               int endIndex,
                               SurrogatePairPolicy beginPolicy,
                               SurrogatePairPolicy endPolicy)
        Returns a new String that is a substring of string, from beginIndex (inclusive) to endIndex (exclusive).

        The difference between this method and String.substring(int, int) is that this method allows you to specify a SurrogatePairPolicy to determine how a surrogate pair should be handled if the pair would normally be split at either the beginIndex or endIndex.

        Parameters:
        string - the String to create a substring from
        beginIndex - the beginning index (inclusive)
        endIndex - the ending index (exclusive)
        beginPolicy - the SurrogatePairPolicy to use if a surrogate pair would normally be split at the beginIndex
        endPolicy - the SurrogatePairPolicy to use if a surrogate pair would normally be split at the endIndex
        Returns:
        a substring of string, from beginIndex to endIndex, unless changed by either beginPolicy or endPolicy
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if string, beginPolicy, or endPolicy is null, beginIndex is negative, endIndex is greater than the length of string, or beginIndex is greater than endIndex

      • substring

        public static String substring(String string,
                               int beginIndex,
                               int endIndex,
                               SurrogatePairPolicy policy)
        Returns a new String that is a substring of the specified String, from beginIndex (inclusive) to endIndex (exclusive).

        The difference between this method and String.substring(int, int) is that this method allows you to specify a SurrogatePairPolicy to determine how a surrogate pair should be handled if the pair would normally be split.

        Parameters:
        string - the String to create a substring from
        beginIndex - the beginning index (inclusive)
        endIndex - the ending index (exclusive)
        policy - the SurrogatePairPolicy to use if a surrogate pair would normally be split
        Returns:
        a substring of the specified String, from beginIndex to endIndex, unless changed by the specified SurrogatePairPolicy
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if string or policy is null, beginIndex is negative, endIndex is greater than the length of string, or beginIndex is greater than endIndex

      • join

        public static String join(Iterable<?> iterable,
                          Object separator)
        Returns a String of the elements of iterable joined together by separator. The separator and each element will use Object.toString() for its text. If separator is null, the elements will be joined together with no separator. If any element is null, "null" will be used.
        Parameters:
        iterable - the elements to join
        separator - the Object to join the elements with
        Returns:
        the joined String
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if iterable is null

      • join

        public static String join(Object[] elements,
                          Object separator)
        Returns a String of the elements of elements joined together by separator. The separator and each element will use Object.toString() for its text. If separator is null, the elements will be joined together with no separator. If any element is null, "null" will be used.
        Parameters:
        elements - the elements to join
        separator - the Object to join the elements with
        Returns:
        the joined String
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if elements is null
